intro: Triantha glutinosa subsp. brevistyla, commonly known as the short-styled triantha, is a herbaceous perennial native to the western United States. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, characterized by its umbellate inflorescences and aromatic foliage. The plant features slender, hairy stems and small, greenish-white flowers arranged in compound umbels. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often have a distinct, sticky surface, which is a notable botanical trait. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in wet meadows and along streambanks.
